objectives.name: Primary Efficacy Objective
objectives.text: To demonstrate that avelumab in combination with axitinib is superior to sunitinib monotherapy in prolonging PFS or OS in the first-line treatment of PD-L1 positive patients (patient population prospectively defined as noted in Section 7.5.1) with aRCC.

objectives.name: Secondary PFS Objective (Unselected)
objectives.text: To demonstrate that avelumab in combination with axitinib is superior to sunitinib monotherapy in prolonging PFS in the first-line treatment of patients with aRCC unselected for PD-L1 expression.

objectives.name: Secondary OS Objective (Unselected)
objectives.text: To demonstrate that avelumab in combination with axitinib is superior to sunitinib monotherapy in prolonging OS in the first-line treatment of patients with aRCC unselected for PD-L1 expression.

objectives.name: Other Efficacy Measures
objectives.text: To evaluate other measures of efficacy of avelumab in combination with axitinib and sunitinib monotherapy in the first-line treatment of aRCC patients.

objectives.name: Next-line Therapy Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate progression-free survival on next-line of therapy (PFS2).

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the overall safety profile of avelumab in combination with axitinib and sunitinib monotherapy in the first-line treatment of aRCC patients.

objectives.name: Toxicity Discontinuation Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the time to treatment discontinuation/failure due to toxicity.

objectives.name: Toxicity Proportion Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the proportion of patients who discontinued treatment due to toxicity.

objectives.name: Pharmacokinetics Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the population pharmacokinetics of avelumab and axitinib when administered in combination.

objectives.name: Biomarker Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate candidate predictive biomarkers in pre-treatment tumor tissue that may aid in the identification of a patient subpopulation most likely to benefit from treatment with avelumab in combination with axitinib and sunitinib monotherapy.

objectives.name: Immunogenicity Objective
objectives.text: To assess the immunogenicity of avelumab when combined with axitinib.

objectives.name: Patient-Reported Outcomes Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the effects of avelumab in combination with axitinib and sunitinib monotherapy on patient-reported outcomes.

endpoints.name: Primary PFS (PD-L1+)
endpoints.text: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) based on Blinded Independent Central Review (BICR) assessment per RECIST v.1.1 for PD-L1 positive patients (patient population prospectively defined as noted in Section 7.5.1).

endpoints.name: Primary OS (PD-L1+)
endpoints.text: Overall Survival (OS) for PD-L1 positive patients (patient population prospectively defined as noted in Section 7.5.1).

endpoints.name: Secondary PFS (Unselected)
endpoints.text: PFS by BICR assessment per RECIST v.1.1 for patients unselected for PD-L1 expression.

endpoints.name: Secondary OS (Unselected)
endpoints.text: OS for patients unselected for PD-L1 expression.

endpoints.name: Tumor Response Endpoints
endpoints.text: Objective Response (OR), Disease Control (DC), Time to Tumor Response (TTR) and Duration of Response (DR) based on BICR assessment and based on Investigator assessment, per RECIST v.1.1.

endpoints.name: Investigator PFS
endpoints.text: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) based on Investigator assessment per RECIST v.1.1.

endpoints.name: PFS2 Endpoint
endpoints.text: Progression-Free Survival on next-line therapy (PFS2).

endpoints.name: Safety Endpoints
endpoints.text: Adverse events (AEs) and laboratory abnormalities as graded by National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v4.03 (Appendix 6); vital signs (blood pressure, pulse rate).

endpoints.name: Time to Discontinuation
endpoints.text: Time to treatment discontinuation/failure due to toxicity.

endpoints.name: Treatment Discontinuation
endpoints.text: Treatment discontinuation due to toxicity.

endpoints.name: PK Parameters
endpoints.text: PK parameters including trough concentrations (Ctrough) of avelumab and trough concentrations (Ctrough) and maximum concentrations (Cmax) of axitinib.

endpoints.name: Biomarker Status
endpoints.text: Tumor tissue biomarker status (ie, positive or negative; based on, for example, PD-L1 expression and/or quantitation of tumor infiltrating CD8+ T lymphocytes as assessed by immunohistochemistry [IHC]).

endpoints.name: Biomarker Subgroup Outcomes
endpoints.text: Measures of clinical outcome (PFS, OS, OR, DC, TTR, and DR) in biomarker-positive and biomarker-negative subgroups.

endpoints.name: Immunogenicity Endpoint
endpoints.text: Anti-drug antibodies (ADAs; nAbs) of avelumab when in combination with axitinib.

endpoints.name: PRO Endpoints
endpoints.text: Patient-Reported Outcomes (PRO): FACT-Kidney Symptom Index (FKSI-19), EuroQol 5-Dimension (EQ 5D).

estimands.name: Primary PFS Estimand (PD-L1+)
estimands.populationSummary: PD-L1 positive patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma (Full Analysis Set) Summary measure: Hazard Ratio (HR) from stratified log-rank test.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation due to toxicity
intercurrentEvents.text: Patient stops study treatment due to unacceptable toxicity

intercurrentEvents.name: Death
intercurrentEvents.text: Death due to any cause prior to progression

intercurrentEvents.name: Subsequent anti-cancer therapy
intercurrentEvents.text: Initiation of new anti-cancer therapy prior to progression

estimands.treatment: Avelumab 10 mg/kg IV Q2W + Axitinib 5 mg PO BID vs Sunitinib 50 mg PO QD (4/2 schedule)
estimands.analysisPopulation: PD-L1 positive patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma (Full Analysis Set)
estimands.variableOfInterest: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) based on BICR assessment per RECIST v.1.1
estimands.summaryMeasure: Hazard Ratio (HR) from stratified log-rank test

estimands.name: Primary OS Estimand (PD-L1+)
estimands.populationSummary: PD-L1 positive patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma (Full Analysis Set) Summary measure: Hazard Ratio (HR) from stratified log-rank test.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation
intercurrentEvents.text: Discontinuation of study treatment for any reason

estimands.treatment: Avelumab 10 mg/kg IV Q2W + Axitinib 5 mg PO BID vs Sunitinib 50 mg PO QD (4/2 schedule)
estimands.analysisPopulation: PD-L1 positive patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma (Full Analysis Set)
estimands.summaryMeasure: Hazard Ratio (HR) from stratified log-rank test

estimands.name: Secondary PFS Estimand (Unselected)
estimands.populationSummary: All randomized patients (All Comers) with advanced renal cell carcinoma Summary measure: Hazard Ratio (HR) from stratified log-rank test.

intercurrentEvents.name: Death
intercurrentEvents.text: Death due to any cause prior to progression

estimands.treatment: Avelumab 10 mg/kg IV Q2W + Axitinib 5 mg PO BID vs Sunitinib 50 mg PO QD (4/2 schedule)
estimands.analysisPopulation: All randomized patients (All Comers) with advanced renal cell carcinoma
estimands.variableOfInterest: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) based on BICR assessment per RECIST v.1.1
estimands.summaryMeasure: Hazard Ratio (HR) from stratified log-rank test

estimands.name: Secondary OS Estimand (Unselected)
estimands.populationSummary: All randomized patients (All Comers) with advanced renal cell carcinoma Summary measure: Hazard Ratio (HR) from stratified log-rank test.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation
intercurrentEvents.text: Discontinuation of study treatment for any reason

estimands.treatment: Avelumab 10 mg/kg IV Q2W + Axitinib 5 mg PO BID vs Sunitinib 50 mg PO QD (4/2 schedule)
estimands.analysisPopulation: All randomized patients (All Comers) with advanced renal cell carcinoma
estimands.summaryMeasure: Hazard Ratio (HR) from stratified log-rank test
